title: Turkey Shepherd's Pie with Butternut Squash

Ingredients.3: 1 salt and ground black pepper to taste

Ingredients.7: 1 pound ground turkey, or more to taste

Ingredients.10: 0.25 teaspoon dried thyme, or to taste (Optional)

Ingredients.11: 0.25 teaspoon dried oregano, or to taste (Optional)

Ingredients.16: 0.25 teaspoon chili powder, or to taste

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Directions.2: Place squash halves on a baking sheet. Brush insides with about 1 tablespoon olive oil and season with salt and pepper.

Directions.3: Bake in the preheated oven until squash is tender enough to scoop out and mash, about 30 minutes. Leave oven on.

Directions.4: Place sweet potatoes into a large pot and cover with water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain.

Directions.5: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a skillet over medium-high heat; stir in onion and garlic. Season with salt and pepper. Saute until onion has softened and browned, 5 to 7 minutes.

Directions.6: Remove 1/3 of the onion-garlic mixture. Add ground turkey to the skillet with the rest of the onions. Saute until turkey is no longer pink, 5 to 7 minutes. Add turkey gravy, Worcestershire sauce, thyme, and oregano. Cook and stir until flavors combine, 2 to 3 minutes.

Directions.7: Remove and discard squash seeds and scoop insides into a bowl. Add sweet potatoes, reserved onion-garlic mixture, butter, and milk; mash together until smooth.

Directions.8: Spread turkey mixture into the bottom of a 9-inch square baking pan. Top with corn and peas; add the sweet potato mash last. Sprinkle with chili powder.

Directions.9: Bake in the hot oven until top begins to brown, 30 to 45 minutes.
